main event: An ANG pilot reported being followed in close formation by a bright light while flying an F-51 between Dayton and Columbus, Ohio on June 24, 1954.
interesting points: The pilot attempted various maneuvers to lose the light but it remained in relatively the same position,The object was initially thought to be a star before its movements clarified it was not,The pilot informed air traffic and the Dayton control tower, but they were unable to observe the object,Another pilot in the area was alerted but did not see anything,The local press showed significant interest in the sighting, prompting a complete investigation.
witness description: an ANG pilot flying an F-51
